SQL_Injection.name: SQL Injection
SQL_Injection.description: Allows attackers to execute malicious SQL statements to control a database server

XSS.name: Cross-Site Scripting
XSS.description: Enables attackers to inject client-side scripts into web pages viewed by other users

CSRF.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery
CSRF.description: Forces users to execute unwanted actions on a web application in which they're authenticated

Security_Headers.name: Security Headers Missing
Security_Headers.description: Missing security headers that help mitigate common web vulnerabilities

SSL_TLS.name: SSL/TLS Vulnerabilities
SSL_TLS.description: Weaknesses in SSL/TLS configuration that could lead to man-in-the-middle attacks

Sensitive_Data_Exposure.name: Sensitive Data Exposure
Sensitive_Data_Exposure.description: Exposure of sensitive data due to insufficient protection

Brute_Force.name: Brute Force Vulnerability
Brute_Force.description: Lack of protection against password guessing attacks

Directory_Traversal.name: Directory Traversal
Directory_Traversal.description: Allows attackers to access restricted directories and files

Command_Injection.name: Command Injection
Command_Injection.description: Allows execution of arbitrary commands on the host operating system

SSRF.name: Server-Side Request Forgery
SSRF.description: Allows attackers to induce the server to make requests to an unintended location

Insecure_Deserialization.name: Insecure Deserialization
Insecure_Deserialization.description: Processing untrusted data through deserialization, potentially leading to remote code execution

JWT_Vulnerabilities.name: JWT Vulnerabilities
JWT_Vulnerabilities.description: Weaknesses in JWT implementation that can lead to authentication bypass or privilege escalation

Broken_Authentication.name: Broken Authentication
Broken_Authentication.description: Flaws in authentication mechanisms that allow attackers to assume other users' identities

XML_External_Entity.name: XML External Entity (XXE)
XML_External_Entity.description: Processing XML input containing references to external entities, leading to data disclosure or DoS

Insecure_File_Upload.name: Insecure File Upload
Insecure_File_Upload.description: Allows attackers to upload malicious files that can be executed on the server

Open_Redirect.name: Open Redirect
Open_Redirect.description: Redirects users to untrusted websites, often used in phishing attacks

CORS_Misconfiguration.name: CORS Misconfiguration
CORS_Misconfiguration.description: Improper CORS configuration allowing unauthorized access to sensitive data

GraphQL_Vulnerabilities.name: GraphQL Vulnerabilities
GraphQL_Vulnerabilities.description: Security issues in GraphQL implementations including introspection, DoS, and injection attacks

API_Key_Exposure.name: API Key Exposure
API_Key_Exposure.description: Exposure of API keys and secrets in client-side code or repositories

Prototype_Pollution.name: Prototype Pollution
Prototype_Pollution.description: JavaScript vulnerability allowing attackers to modify object prototypes, leading to DoS or XSS

DOM_Based_XSS.name: DOM-Based XSS
DOM_Based_XSS.description: Client-side JavaScript modifies the DOM in an unsafe way based on user-controllable data

NoSQL_Injection.name: NoSQL Injection
NoSQL_Injection.description: Injection attacks targeting NoSQL databases like MongoDB

CRLF_Injection.name: CRLF Injection
CRLF_Injection.description: Injection of CRLF sequences to split HTTP response headers, potentially leading to header injection or XSS

Server_Side_Template_Injection.name: Server-Side Template Injection
Server_Side_Template_Injection.description: Injection of template directives in template engines, potentially leading to RCE

Insecure_Direct_Object_Reference.name: Insecure Direct Object Reference
Insecure_Direct_Object_Reference.description: Exposing internal implementation objects to users without access control checks

Session_Fixation.name: Session Fixation
Session_Fixation.description: Attacker sets a user's session ID to one known to the attacker, then waits for user to authenticate

Clickjacking.name: Clickjacking
Clickjacking.description: UI redress attack where users are tricked into clicking on something different from what they perceive

WebSocket_Vulnerabilities.name: WebSocket Vulnerabilities
WebSocket_Vulnerabilities.description: Security issues in WebSocket implementations including lack of authentication and encryption

HTTP_Parameter_Pollution.name: HTTP Parameter Pollution
HTTP_Parameter_Pollution.description: Supplying multiple parameters with the same name to manipulate or bypass security controls

Content_Security_Policy.name: Content Security Policy Issues
Content_Security_Policy.description: Missing or misconfigured Content Security Policy headers that could allow XSS attacks

Subdomain_Takeover.name: Subdomain Takeover
Subdomain_Takeover.description: Vulnerable DNS records pointing to services that can be claimed by attackers

OAuth_Vulnerabilities.name: OAuth Vulnerabilities
OAuth_Vulnerabilities.description: Security issues in OAuth implementation including token leakage and improper validation

SAML_Vulnerabilities.name: SAML Vulnerabilities
SAML_Vulnerabilities.description: Security issues in SAML implementation including signature bypassing and XML attacks

Host_Header_Injection.name: Host Header Injection
Host_Header_Injection.description: Manipulation of the Host header to perform cache poisoning, password reset poisoning, etc.

Path_Traversal.name: Path Traversal
Path_Traversal.description: Accessing files and directories outside of the web root folder using ../ sequences

Insecure_Cryptographic_Storage.name: Insecure Cryptographic Storage
Insecure_Cryptographic_Storage.description: Improper encryption of sensitive data or use of weak cryptographic algorithms

Business_Logic_Vulnerabilities.name: Business Logic Vulnerabilities
Business_Logic_Vulnerabilities.description: Flaws in the design and implementation of application that allow attackers to manipulate legitimate functionality

Race_Condition.name: Race Condition
Race_Condition.description: Vulnerability occurring when multiple processes access and manipulate the same data concurrently

File_Inclusion.name: File Inclusion
File_Inclusion.description: Including files from local filesystem (LFI) or remote servers (RFI) leading to information disclosure or RCE

Mass_Assignment.name: Mass Assignment
Mass_Assignment.description: Binding client-provided data to data models without proper filtering of properties

Server_Side_Request_Forgery.name: Server-Side Request Forgery
Server_Side_Request_Forgery.description: Attacker can make the server perform requests to unintended locations

Improper_Access_Control.name: Improper Access Control
Improper_Access_Control.description: Insufficient authorization checks allowing users to access resources they shouldn't have access to

Insecure_CORS_Configuration.name: Insecure CORS Configuration
Insecure_CORS_Configuration.description: Misconfigured Cross-Origin Resource Sharing headers allowing unauthorized access to sensitive data

HTTP_Response_Splitting.name: HTTP Response Splitting
HTTP_Response_Splitting.description: Injection of CRLF sequences to split HTTP response headers, potentially leading to cache poisoning or XSS

Unvalidated_Redirects.name: Unvalidated Redirects
Unvalidated_Redirects.description: Application redirects to user-supplied URLs without validation, enabling phishing attacks

Weak_Password_Policy.name: Weak Password Policy
Weak_Password_Policy.description: Insufficient password requirements allowing easily guessable passwords

Missing_Rate_Limiting.name: Missing Rate Limiting
Missing_Rate_Limiting.description: Lack of request rate limiting enabling brute force, DoS, or enumeration attacks

Improper_Error_Handling.name: Improper Error Handling
Improper_Error_Handling.description: Verbose error messages revealing sensitive information about the application

Insecure_HTTP_Methods.name: Insecure HTTP Methods
Insecure_HTTP_Methods.description: Dangerous HTTP methods enabled (PUT, DELETE) that could allow unauthorized modifications

Insufficient_Logging.name: Insufficient Logging & Monitoring
Insufficient_Logging.description: Inadequate logging of security events making it difficult to detect and respond to breaches

Hardcoded_Credentials.name: Hardcoded Credentials
Hardcoded_Credentials.description: Credentials embedded in source code or configuration files

Vulnerable_Dependencies.name: Vulnerable Dependencies
Vulnerable_Dependencies.description: Use of libraries and components with known vulnerabilities

Insecure_Randomness.name: Insecure Randomness
Insecure_Randomness.description: Use of weak random number generators for security-critical functions

Unrestricted_File_Upload.name: Unrestricted File Upload
Unrestricted_File_Upload.description: Allows uploading of potentially dangerous file types that could be executed on the server

Insecure_Cookies.name: Insecure Cookies
Insecure_Cookies.description: Cookies missing secure or HttpOnly flags, or with overly permissive settings
